intro: Byrsonima stipulacea, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or cupuaçu, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a fruit that resembles a large, green, hairy apple, which is harvested when mature. The fruit contains a rich, creamy pulp that is used in various food products. Botanically, it belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
